abstract.text: Marks the start of a task that should continue if the app enters the background.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: A handler to be called shortly before the app’s remaining background time reaches 0. Use this handler to clean up and mark the end of the background task. Failure to end the task explicitly will result in the termination of the app. The system calls the handler synchronously on the main thread, blocking the app’s suspension momentarily.
A unique identifier for the new background task. You must pass this value to the
method to mark the end of this task. This method returns
if running in the background isn’t possible.

This method requests additional background execution time for your app. Call this method when leaving a task unfinished might be detrimental to your app’s user experience. For example, call this method before writing data to a file to prevent the system from suspending your app while the operation is in progress. For background tasks requiring more time, use

Call this method as early as possible before starting your task, preferably before your app actually enters the background. The method requests the task assertion for your app asynchronously. If you call this method shortly before your app is due to be suspended, there’s a chance that the system might suspend your app before that task assertion is granted. For example, don’t call this method at the very end of your
method and expect your app to continue running. If the system is unable to grant the task assertion, it calls your expiration handler.
Each call to this method must be balanced by a matching call to the
method. Apps running background tasks have a finite amount of time in which to run them. (You can find out the maximum background time available using the
property.) If you don’t call
for each task before time expires, the system kills the app. If you provide a block object in the
parameter, the system calls your handler before time expires to give you a chance to end the task.

You can call this method at any point in your app’s execution. You may also call this method multiple times to mark the beginning of several background tasks that run in parallel. However, each task must be ended separately. You identify a given task using the value returned by this method.
To assist with debugging, this method generates a name for the task, based on the name of the calling method or function. If you want to specify a custom name, use the
method instead.
This method can be safely called on a non-main thread. To extend the execution time of an app extension, use the
method of
instead.
If you’re having trouble debugging your background task code, you might try using the
method instead of this one. That method provides the same behavior but lets you specify a debugger-visible name for your task.

abstract.text: Request the system to launch your app in the background to run tasks.
A collection of information about the current process.
Performs the specified block asynchronously and notifies you if the process is about to be suspended.
Construct and manage a graphical, event-driven user interface for your iOS, iPadOS, or tvOS app.
The centralized point of control and coordination for apps running in iOS.
Indicates whether the app can refresh content when running in the background.
A notification that posts when the app’s status for downloading content in the background changes.
The maximum amount of time remaining for the app to run in the background.
Marks the start of a task that should continue if the app enters the background.
Marks the start of a task with a custom name that should continue if the app enters the background.
Marks the end of a specific long-running background task.
Tells the delegate that the app is now in the background.
Constants that indicate whether background execution is enabled for the app.
A unique token that identifies a request to run in the background.
A token that indicates an invalid task request.
A singleton actor whose executor is equivalent to the main dispatch queue.
The return type of functions that don’t explicitly specify a return type, that is, an empty tuple `()`.

inlineContent.text: A handler to be called shortly before the app’s remaining background time reaches 0. Use this handler to clean up and mark the end of the background task. Failure to end the task explicitly will result in the termination of the app. The system calls the handler synchronously on the main thread, blocking the app’s suspension momentarily.
A unique identifier for the new background task. You must pass this value to the
method to mark the end of this task. This method returns
if running in the background isn’t possible.
